intro: Lepidaploa tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or sagebrush steppe. It produces small, spiky fruit capsules that release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Lepidaploa tenella is an important component of its native ecosystem, providing food and habitat for various insects and wildlife.
